title: even on 64 bits systems owncloud is unable to upload files bigger than 2 gb
body:
hi all.

i'm trying to make owncloud allow uploads thru the web interface for files bigger than 2 gb without any luck.
i applied the suggestions under http://owncloud.org/support/big-files/ but they did no help me.

my basic info is:

• system
turnkey linux 12.1 / debian 6.0.7 squeeze
kernerl info: uname -m: x86_64
cpu info: grep flags /proc/cpuinfo: lm (64-bit processor)
apache 2.2.16 (debian)
php version 5.3.3-7+squeeze15
mysql 5.1.66

• filesystem
filesystem            size  used avail use% mounted on
/dev/simfs            4.0g  888m  3.2g  22% /
/dev/sdc              8.1t  1.2t  6.6t  15% /disco5
tmpfs                 5.0g     0  5.0g   0% /lib/init/rw
tmpfs                 5.0g  4.0k  5.0g   1% /dev/shm

both owncloud data, the shares and php temp dir are under "disco5" with more than 6 tb of free space

• php.ini
upload_tmp_dir = /disco5/temporarios
upload_max_filesize = 6442450944
post_max_size = 7086696039
memory_limit = 100663296
max_execution_time = 3600
max_input_time = 3600

• .htaccess
php_value upload_max_filesize 6442450944
php_value post_max_size 7086696039
php_value memory_limit 100663296

• test file
2.9 gb mp4 file

here is an example of what happens when i try to upload something:
![owncloud_uploading](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1677707/702221/8774669a-dd8c-11e2-9506-54ec90d29870.jpg)

and this is what happens after the upload complete:
![owncloud_error](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1677707/702228/ab88092e-dd8c-11e2-8d18-4833e25db2ac.jpg)

(although every once in a while it complains about the value of the html form)

is there anything that i could try to see if this problem disappears? 

thank you so much!
pedro fardilha
